5126e87a-2f0d-4729-9049-025fdd264359.description: This course adds on to the Basic Pneumatics course in Level I. Students will learn how to read and interpret electropneumatics circuits and dive deeper into how to maintain, troubleshoot, and repair pneumatic systems. This extends your knowledge of complex pneumatic systems and improves your troubleshooting skills. Practical exercises on training equipment for setup, commissioning, troubleshooting, and fault elimination facilitate the transfer of knowledge to real world industrial applications.
5126e87a-2f0d-4729-9049-025fdd264359.name: Applied Fluid Power - 1474

c67919f6-639e-406b-8e59-ba9fdd2241ca.description: Building upon the base knowledge gained in the Level I Industry 4.0 Course, students will delve deeper into the IIOT (Industrial Internet of Things) as it applies to modern production systems. Much of the focus will be on how MES (Manufacturing Execution Systems) send and receive data from the production process. Participants will work with the MES and learn how to process, utilize, and protect critical data.
c67919f6-639e-406b-8e59-ba9fdd2241ca.name: Applied Industry 4.0 - 1468

8a509cbf-ade4-4b21-9079-766cfb665e08.description: The driving force behind most industrial applications is Mechanical Systems. Gears, drives, bearings, pulleys, and more are found in nearly everything that moves. The Mechanical Systems course covers the installation, use, maintenance, and troubleshooting of mechanical drive components and systems. The curriculum is divided into various topics which deal with the components encountered in industry.
8a509cbf-ade4-4b21-9079-766cfb665e08.name: Applied Mechanical Systems - 1477

4a0e9d17-d623-442f-8160-fc334d4f220f.description: PLC II expands on the topics covered in PLC I and utilizes the same equipment. Students will go deeper into programming PLCs, incorporate HMI (Human Machine Interface) programming and modifying programs to include changes in the applications. This is a highly sought-after skill in modern industry.
4a0e9d17-d623-442f-8160-fc334d4f220f.name: Applied PLC Technology II – Allen Bradley - 1479

cc9b4e6f-4f7a-4fb0-8cf3-0a3b52c524b8.description: This comprehensive course guides students through detailed project-oriented learning activities. Starting with the basics of each sensor, students perform practical exercises in a simplified work environment, allowing them to focus on smart sensors. Students can also connect these sensors to a PLC over PROFINET®, Ethernet/IP™ or Modbus®, just like in industry.
cc9b4e6f-4f7a-4fb0-8cf3-0a3b52c524b8.name: Applied Principles of Smart Sensors - 1485

7352aa6a-c680-4967-adf8-8f14a579ab7c.description: In modern Industry, the ability to identify products and make decisions based on this data is a critical factor. There are various means to do this, and this course will explore three of those areas. This course will give participants the ability to explore and understand RFID (Radio Frequency Identification) utilizing Tags, Readers, and Writers as well as Vision Systems that utilize QR Coders/Barcodes. All of these elements provide critical data that modern industry relies on.
7352aa6a-c680-4967-adf8-8f14a579ab7c.name: Applied Product ID Fundamentals - 1482

e0e71d9d-fd4d-4386-b836-0cdf325dd7a7.description: The Applied Robotics Course expands on Robotics Fundamentals. Students will work more extensively with the CIROS software and real industrial robotic applications. Robots rarely do work in isolation. They interact with other manual and automated systems. The MPS Robot Cell allows students to learn about these topics and how to program and edit robot programs and positions to accomplish various tasks.

It applies these fundamentals to simple applications that would be found in residential, light commercial and simple industrial use.

7622ef79-67f7-4244-a7ab-2b82bf5d5871.description: The Industrial Electricity 2 certificate builds upon the Industrial Electricity 1 certificate. Candidates should understand more complex motor starting circuits such as jogging, hand-off-automatic, reversing, and reduced voltage starting. They should be familiar with time-based, count-based and sequential control of multiple output loads utilizing control relay logic and automatic input devices such as limit, flow and pressure switches to provide feedback.

8a249400-7670-42f6-afa2-c30f6af3bdf8.description: Phlebotomy plays a key role in laboratory testing and patient care. It is widely accepted that the quality of a laboratory test is only as good as the specimen that was collected. Due to the need to be cost effective, Phlebotomy has now become a specialized area of clinical laboratory practice. Although a hospital is a common place where a phlebotomy technician may work, clinics, acute care facilities as well as doctor’s offices are also ideal places for a phlebotomist to work.
8a249400-7670-42f6-afa2-c30f6af3bdf8.name: Phlebotomy Technician Certification - 8773

a7aa24de-4916-486e-ae40-f7228eaedf73.description: A phlebotomy technician's primary task is to collect patient blood samples through venipuncture or microtechniques. Often, they are the only members of the medical laboratory team who come into contact with the patient and thus play an important role. Other important tasks that they may carry out include: verifying patient or donor records, testing drug levels in blood, labeling and storing blood samples for processing, analyzing blood cells and body fluids, and performing patient interviews.
a7aa24de-4916-486e-ae40-f7228eaedf73.name: Phlebotomy Technician (CPT) - 8535

fc4efda3-6278-4c7a-835c-3753e24a0c7f.description: Students who receive NC3’s Wire Pathways certification will: Discover the proper use of professional tools for creating pathways for cabling through commercial and residential framing materials and ingress into metal panels and control boxes. Gain experience choosing the “right tool for the job” and its impact on tool life, workmanship and productivity.
